üìã MICROSOFT LEARN COMPLIANCE CHECKLIST

Section titled ‚Äúüìã MICROSOFT LEARN COMPLIANCE CHECKLIST‚Äù

‚úÖ Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

Section titled ‚Äú‚úÖ Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)‚Äù
  • ‚úÖ Time to Detect: Automated monitoring configured
  • ‚úÖ Time to Mitigate: Alert system designed
  • ‚úÖ Time to Remediate: Error tracking prepared
  • ‚ùå Blameless Postmortems: Process not defined
  • ‚ùå Error Budgets: SLIs/SLOs not established

‚úÖ DevOps Monitoring Fundamentals

Section titled ‚Äú‚úÖ DevOps Monitoring Fundamentals‚Äù
  • ‚úÖ Telemetry Collection: Datadog integration complete
  • ‚úÖ Synthetic Monitoring: Playwright tests designed
  • ‚úÖ Real User Monitoring: RUM integration planned
  • ‚ùå Validated Learning: A/B testing not implemented
  • ‚ùå Continuous Improvement: Feedback loops missing

‚úÖ Azure Well-Architected Framework

Section titled ‚Äú‚úÖ Azure Well-Architected Framework‚Äù
  • ‚úÖ Operational Excellence: Monitoring system designed
  • ‚úÖ Security: Bot protection and threat detection
  • ‚úÖ Reliability: Health checks and error handling
  • ‚ùå Performance Efficiency: Optimization not complete
  • ‚ùå Cost Optimization: Resource monitoring needed

üîÆ FUTURE ROADMAP

Section titled ‚ÄúüîÆ FUTURE ROADMAP‚Äù

Q1 2025: Foundation & Reliability

Section titled ‚ÄúQ1 2025: Foundation & Reliability‚Äù
  • Complete test infrastructure repair
  • Implement comprehensive monitoring
  • Establish SRE practices and SLOs
  • Deploy to production with full observability

Q2 2025: Scale & Performance

Section titled ‚ÄúQ2 2025: Scale & Performance‚Äù
  • Advanced performance optimization
  • Multi-region deployment monitoring
  • Automated scaling based on geographic demand
  • Machine learning for anomaly detection

Q3 2025: Intelligence & Automation

Section titled ‚ÄúQ3 2025: Intelligence & Automation‚Äù
  • Predictive analytics for user behavior
  • Automated incident response
  • Advanced business intelligence dashboards
  • AI-powered monitoring optimization

This assessment follows Microsoft Learn best practices for cloud application monitoring, observability, and site reliability engineering. All recommendations are based on proven enterprise patterns and Azure Well-Architected Framework principles.
